title.text: Argviz: Interactive Visualization of Topic Dynamics in Multi-party Conversations

abstractContent.text: We introduce an efficient, interactive framework-Argviz-for experts to analyze the dynamic topical structure of multi-party conversations.
Users inject their needs, expertise, and insights into models via iterative topic refinement.
The refined topics feed into a segmentation model, whose outputs are shown to users via multiple coordinated views.

introductionContent.text: Uncovering the structure of conversations often requires close reading by a human expert to be effective.

Political debates are an interesting example: political scientists carefully analyze what gets said in debates to explore how candidates shape the debate's agenda and frame issues or how answers subtly (or not so subtly) shift the conversation by dodging the question that was asked ().

Computational methods can contribute to the analysis of topical dynamics, for example through topic segmentation, dividing a conversation into smaller, topically coherent segments (Purver, 2011); or through identifying and summarizing the topics under discussion (.

However, the topics uncovered by such methods can be difficult for people to interpret, and previous visualization frameworks for topic models-e.g.,), TopicViz (, the Topical Guide, 1 or topic model visualization (Chaney and Blei, 2012)-are not particularly well suited for linearly structured conversations.
This paper describes Argviz, an integrated, interactive system for analyzing the topical dynamics of 1 http://tg.byu.edu/ multi-party conversations.

We bring together previous work on Interactive Topic Modeling (ITM) (, which allows users to efficiently inject their needs, expertise, and insights into model building via iterative topic refinement, with Speaker Identity for Topic Segmentation (SITS)), a state-of-the-art model for topic segmentation and discovery of topic shifts in conversations.

entities.text: discovery of topic shifts in conversations

introductionContent.text: Argviz's interface allows users to quickly grasp the topical flow of the conversation, discern when the topic changes and by whom, and interactively visualize the conversation's details on demand.
